title: Chancellor of Germany - Wikipedia
snippet: On 30 April 1945, when Hitler committed suicide, he was briefly succeeded as Chancellor by Joseph Goebbels and as President of Germany by Grand Admiral Karl Dönitz. When Goebbels also committed suicide, Dönitz did not appoint a successor as Chancellor, instead appointing Count Schwerin von ...

title: President of Germany - Wikipedia
snippet: In Germany the new head of state was called the Reichspräsident. Friedrich Ebert served as Germany's first president, followed by Paul von Hindenburg. The office effectively came to an end upon Hindenburg's death in 1934 when its powers were merged with those of the chancellor.

title: Olaf Scholz | Facts, Biography, Cabinet, & Chancellor of Germany | Britannica
snippet: Olaf Scholz (born June 14, 1958, Osnabrück, West Germany [now in Germany]) is a German politician who served as chancellor of Germany from 2021 to 2025. A longtime member of Germany’s center-left Social Democratic Party (SPD), Scholz served ...

snippet: The Präsidium (the Prussian king), which now had also the title Emperor, named the chancellor. ... On 9 November 1918, Chancellor Max von Baden handed over his office to Friedrich Ebert.
